A 40-year-old man presents to the neck lump clinic with a prominent solitary thyroid nodule. The fine-needle aspirate cytology performed shows features similar to benign adenomatous hyperplasia. He subsequently undergoes a thyroid lobectomy and the histology of the surgical specimen confirms a diagnosis of follicular carcinoma. Which of the following is a characteristic of follicular carcinoma?

options.label: A
options.text: It arises from the parafollicular cells of the thyroid gland

options.label: B
options.text: Fine-needle aspiration cytology can sufficiently differentiate it from benign adenomatous hyperplasia

options.label: C
options.text: The majority of such cases are multifocal

options.label: D
options.text: Metastasis tends to occur via the bloodstream to the bone and other remote sites

questions.correct_answer: D. Metastasis tends to occur via the bloodstream to the bone and other remote sites

A 63-year-old lady undergoes a parathyroidectomy for the treatment of primary hyperparathyroidism under the care of the endocrine surgeons. Intraoperatively, she is found to have a right inferior parathyroid adenoma, which is excised. On the ward round the following morning, she complains of hoarseness in her voice which she did not experience prior to the operation. What is the most likely cause for her symptoms?

options.label: A
options.text: Unilateral damage to the external laryngeal nerve

options.label: B
options.text: Unilateral damage to the recurrent laryngeal nerve

options.label: C
options.text: Bilateral damage to the recurrent laryngeal nerve

questions.correct_answer: B. Unilateral damage to the recurrent laryngeal nerve

questions.text: A 56-year-old male presents to his GP with a 3-week history of sweating, headaches, constipation, and itchy lesions over his back. On examination, his blood pressure is 166/94 mmHg and his pulse rate is 104/min. Twenty-four-hour urinary catecholamines, metanephrines and vanillylmandelic acid are found to be elevated. A CT scan and a 131I-meta-iodo-benzyl-guanidine scan confirm the presence of a phaeochromocytoma. The patient is subsequently also found to have a medullary carcinoma of the thyroid. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Which among the following statements concerning pathologies of the breast is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: A breast cyst is considered to be an aberration of normal development and involution

options.label: B
options.text: Early menopause is a risk factor for the development of breast cancer

options.label: C
options.text: Invasive ductal carcinoma accounts for less than 20% of breast cancers

options.label: D
options.text: The nipple–areolar complex is spared when undertaking a simple mastectomy

questions.correct_answer: A. A breast cyst is considered to be an aberration of normal development and involution

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding subclavian steal syndrome is true?

options.label: A
options.text: There is reversal of blood flow in the ipsilateral vertebral artery.

options.label: B
options.text: There is reversal of blood flow in the contralateral carotid artery.

options.label: C
options.text: There is reversal of blood flow in the contralateral vertebral artery.

options.label: D
options.text: There is bilateral reversal of blood flow in the vertebral arteries

questions.correct_answer: A. There is reversal of blood flow in the ipsilateral vertebral artery.

A 45-year-old female with a 3 cm palpable right breast lesion is referred to a breast clinic for further evaluation. On examination, there is a 3 cm hard mass in the right upper quadrant. She is also found to have palpable right axillary lymph nodes. The most appropriate next step in the management is:

options.label: A
options.text: Ultrasound guided core biopsy of the breast lesion and FNAC of the axillary lymph node.

options.label: B
options.text: Ultrasound of the breast lesion and sentinel lymph node biopsy.

options.label: C
options.text: Mammogram followed by core biopsy of the breast lesion

options.label: D
options.text: Wide local excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy.

questions.correct_answer: C. Mammogram followed by core biopsy of the breast lesion

A 68-year-old man collapses in the middle of a mall. A good Samaritan immediately rushes to help the victim. options.label: D
options.text: Increase the depth of sternal depression

questions.correct_answer: C. Increase the rate of compression.
